segments.text: I can’t take my eyes off the woman at the sink, her focus so intense yet misplaced.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the water spills over the sink edge feels like a metaphor for neglect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel sadness for her, so entrenched in her task while danger brews around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, that boy is dancing on the edge of calamity, reaching for cookies like it’s a game.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every fiber of my being wants to shout, to warn him of the impending fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s hopeful gesture for a cookie is both sweet and alarming; she doesn’t understand the risk.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s shocking how a simple act of kindness can morph into a nearly tragic moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden’s stillness feels almost mocking, contrasting with the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice what’s happening behind her, or if she’ll remain lost in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every second that passes feels like a countdown; I hold my breath, waiting for the inevitable.
segments.speaker: PAR
